getFolderFiles

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File> getFolderFiles(java.lang.String folderPath,
                                                               FileUtility.OPTION... args)
Get the folders/files within a particular folder

Parameters:
folderPath - the path to the folder
args - an OPTION RECURSIVE = recurse into child directories for details INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES = include details of files AND directories in the result INCLUDE_ONLY_DIRECTORIES = include ONLY diretories in the result
Returns:
a List of Files (files and/or folders)

deleteFolder

public static void deleteFolder(java.lang.String folderPath)

deleteFolder

public static void deleteFolder(java.lang.String folderPath,
                                java.lang.Boolean keepRootFolder)
Deletes a folder's contents

Parameters:
folderPath - the path to the folder to delete
keepRootFolder - if true, only the contents will be deleted, false will delete the folder itself as well

deleteFolder

public static void deleteFolder(java.io.File folder,
                                java.lang.Boolean keepRootFolder)
Deletes a folder's contents

Parameters:
folder - the java.io.File folder to delete
keepRootFolder - if true, only the contents will be deleted, false will delete the folder itself as well

copyFolder

public static void copyFolder(java.io.File sourceLocation,
                              java.io.File targetLocation)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Copies a folder and its contents to a new location. If the target location does not exist, it will be created.

Parameters:
sourceLocation - the source folder and files
targetLocation - where the folder and files will be copied
Throws:
java.io.IOException

copyFolder

public static void copyFolder(java.io.File sourceLocation,
                              java.io.File targetLocation,
                              java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> excludeDirectories)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Copies a folder and its contents to a new location. If the target location does not exist, it will be created.

Parameters:
sourceLocation - the source folder and files
targetLocation - where the folder and files will be copied
excludeDirectories - a List of directory names to ignore during the copy, ex: [.svn, .save] will ignore all .svn and .save folders
Throws:
java.io.IOException

folderName - the folder name to attempt to locate
